properties.otherAdvice:
Australia Cup Final: Sydney United 58 FC v Macarthur FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm and full-time around 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Sydney Kings at WIN Entertainment Centre, start 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads in Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Sports and Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the game. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the venue.

Knockout Outdoor Music Festival at GIANTS Stadium and Sydney Showground. Start at 2pm finish at 11pm.

With up to 50,000 music fans expected, motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event with large volumes of rideshare and taxi movements.

Fans driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before.

The annual Coonabarabran Pony Club Parade will take place on Friday 30 September 2022. The Newell Hwy (John St) will be closed between Edward Street and Delgarno Street between 3:00pm and 3:30pm.

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian and horse activity in the area and follow the directions of traffic controllers.
properties.diversions: Motorists will be detoured via Edwards Street, Namoi Street, Saleyards Road and Gardener Street. The detour is suitable for all vehicles.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT - Coonabarabran Pony Club Parade

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of motorsport fans are expected to attend the 2022 Repco Bathurst 1000 at Mount Panorama from Wednesday 5 October to Sunday 9 October.

Delays are expected on major roads approaching Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Hwy and Bells Line of Rd from Sydney, Mitchell Hwy from Orange, Mid Western Hwy from Cowra and Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Traffic controllers will be on-site on local roads to manage access to and from the Mount Panorama precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time over the weekend and expect delays on Monday 10 October as fans head home from Bathurst.

_____________________________

VICTORIA PASS - Monday 10 October

Traffic is expected to be heavy along the Great Western Highway from Bathurst towards Sydney, with significant eastbound delays expected at Blackheath in the Blue Mountains. Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Highway at Mount Victoria, with queing expected.

In the event of eastbound traffic queues extending from Blackheath to Mount Victoria, traffic management will be in place at the bottom of Victoria Pass on Great Western Highway, Little Hartley. Traffic will be held at this location to avoid breakdowns resulting from queuing on Victoria Pass, and to ensure the safe passage of motorists up the Pass. 

_______________________________

COWRA - Monday 10 October

Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Mid Western Hwy in Cowra with delays and queuing expected.

The Weddin Mountain Muster is a five-day horse trail riding event held in Grenfell from Monday 26 September to Friday 30 September.

On Tuesday 27 September, a 40 km/h speed reduction will be implemented on the Mid Western Highway at the Adelargo Road / Derribong Road intersection to ensure the horses can cross the highway safely. The speed reduction will be implemented only when horses are crossing.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around Crown St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event on Crown St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Crown St will be closed between Cleveland St and Foveaux St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, High Holborn St, Jesson Lane, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers Lane will also be closed during this time.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Baptist St, Cleveland St, Chalmers St, Randle St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Lane. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Express trains and major event buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Grand Final: Panthers v Eels at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Gates open from 1pm with preliminary matches from 1:20pm. NRL Grand Final kick-off at 7:30pm and full time around 9:35pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct as up to 80,000 fans travel to the stadium for the match.

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park will be closed for the game. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
The Repco Bathurst 1000 kicks off on Wednesday 5 October with the Supercars Transporter and Drivers Parade.

From 11:15am until 12:30pm, Bentinck St will be closed between Great Western Hwy and Howick St. Great Western Hwy between Durham St and William St will be reduced to one lane eastbound. Turning lanes from Great Western Hwy into William St, Bentinck St and Durham St towards the CBD will be closed. 

Traffic control will be in place for the safety of workers and motorists.

Motorists are advised to drive to the conditions, and follow the directions of signs and traffic control.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicles: Traffic will be detoured via Havannah St and Howick St. 

Heavy vehicles: Use Havannah St to rejoin Rocket St

properties.otherAdvice:
The Come Home to Gilgandra Festival is a 3-4 day event to bring the small country town of Gilgandra back to life after years of droughts, bushfires, the mice plague and the COVID-19 pandemic. 


On Saturday 1 October, a street parade will be held in the main street Castlereagh Highway & Oxley Highway will be closed between Wrigley Street and Wamboin Street from 9am until 12pm.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicle detour: Wamboin Street and Wrigley Street (both directions)

Heavy vehicle detour: Federation Street and/or Hargraves Lane (depending on destination)
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT - Come Home to Gilgandra Festival

properties.otherAdvice:
Traffic control will be in place at the intersection of Goonoo Goonoo Road and Jack Smyth Road.

Intermittent stops will be in place for the safety of event patrons.

Traffic control will be in place between the following times;

Friday: 2pm-6pm

Saturday and Sunday: 9.30am-3pm

Monday: 9am-11am
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT National Thunder Motorcycle Rally

properties.diversions:
Vehicles travelling from the south, west and east shall be detoured along Kookora Street, Yambil Street, and Jondaryan Avenue.

Vehicles travelling from the north shall be detoured along Wakaden Street, Kooringal Avenue, Kookora Street and Yambil Street. 

B-Doubles travelling from the south, east or west will be required to utilise Willandra Avenue, Bridge Road and the surrounding b-double network to access their destination.

The B-double route along Wyangan Avenue, Palla Street and Kookora Street will also be affected by the event.

B-double vehicles using Kooringal Avenue and Kookora Street will be held at the intersection of Kookora Street and Banna Avenue and will be marshalled through the event by an approved traffic controller where breaks in the procession are identified.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Epsom Day - The Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:50am, last race at 5:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Traffic will also be heavier than usual around the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – midnight: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

properties.otherAdvice:
Listen Out Music Festival at Brazilian Fields, Centennial Park from 12pm to 10pm.

With more than 20,000 music fans expected, traffic will be heavier than usual in the area as crowds travel to and from the festival, and to the races at nearby Royal Randwick Racecourse.

Sections of Driver Ave, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd will close from 8pm until 11pm to allow festivalgoers to safely leave the area.

Motorists driving in the area should allow extra travel time.

Special event clearways will also be in place from 4am until midnight on key roads in Surry Hills, Centennial Park and Moore Park. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
More than 6,000 riders will take part in a 10km or 50km cycle ride for the annual Spring Cycle event on Sunday 16 October. Both rides start from St Leonards Park in North Sydney, the 10km ride finishes at Tumbalong Park in Darling Harbour while the 50km ride finishes at Olympic Park. From Darling Harbour to Olympic Park riders will share roads with motorists and abide by regular road rules. Major roads will close along the first 10km of the course including the Cahill Expressway and sections of the Western Distributor from 4am. Other key road closures include:

North Sydney

  • 4am to 10.30am: Miller St between Falcon St and Ridge St and Berry St from Pacific Hwy to Walker St.
  • 4am to 11am: Miller St between Ridge St and the Pacific Hwy, Little Walker St and Arthur St
  • Local roads off Berry St will be closed from 6am to 9.30am. A section of Blue St at North Sydney Station will close from 4am to 9.30am.

Cahill Expressway & Sydney Harbour Bridge

  • 4am to 10:30am: Lanes 7 and 8 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Mount St and High St on ramps. Lanes 3 and 6 will be closed on the Sydney Harbour Bridge deck – two lanes will remain open in both directions. A 40km/h speed limit will be in effect while riders share lanes on the bridge. 
  • 4am to 11am: Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass in both directions

Sydney CBD, Millers Point, Barangaroo

  • 4am to 10.30am: sections of Upper Fort St and Watson Rd
  • 4am to 11am: Hickson Rd southbound from Towns Place to Napoleon St, sections of Towns Place, Dalgety Rd, Napoleon St, Sussex St and King St

Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the City

  • 4am to 11.15am – closed from Pyrmont on-ramp to City North off ramp at King St. Motorists travelling citybound from the Anzac Bridge will be diverted via the Bathurst St off-ramp where they can re-join the Harbour Bridge via Harbour St or Kent St.

Darling Harbour and Pyrmont

  • 4am to 11.15am: sections of Pyrmont St, Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Murray St, Union St, Bunn St and other local roads.
  • 4am to 11.30am: Darling Drive closed southbound from Pyrmont Bridge Rd to Pier St

Local roads in Olympic Park will also be closed between 7.30am and 3pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of the course in North Sydney, Millers Point and Pyrmont between 3am and 11am, and in Five Dock between 5am and 11am. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Harbour Bridge And Cahill Expressway

From 4:00am to 11:00am

  • Sydney Harbour Bridge deck, lane 3 northbound and lane 6 southbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Grosvenor Street on ramp Northbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Clarence Street on ramp Northbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Cahill Expressway Lanes 7 and 8 Southbound

  • Cahill Expressway at The Domain Tunnel on ramp Northbound
  • Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Cahill Expressway approach from Warringah Freeway Northbound

Western Distributor

  • Western Distributor Pyrmont Street on ramp Southbound
  • Western Distributor Sydney Harbour Bridge on ramp from Anzac Bridge Eastbound
  • Western Distributor King Street off ramp from Anzac Bridge Northbound

Note: citybound traffic from Anzac Bridge will be diverted via Bathurst Street off ramp


North Sydney

From 4:00am to 10:30am

2 Vehicle crossover on Miller St at Ridge St open at all times

  • Little Spring St between Berry St and Spring St
  • Ward St from Berry St

1 Local access available from Spring St to Denison St. No access to Berry St from Denison St.


The Rocks / Millers Point / Sydney CBD

  • Grosvenor St between Lang St and York St Westbound
  • Upper Fort Street between Watson Road and Sydney Observatory
  • Watson Road between Upper Fort Street and Argyle Street

4 Managed local access for Napoleon Street residents. No access to Hickson Road

5 Managed access to Slip Street from Erskine Street. Managed access to Hyatt Regency Sydney hotel.


Darling Harbour / Pyrmont

From 4:00am to 11:15am

  • Bunn Lane 1 between Pyrmont Street and Experiment Street Westbound
  • Bunn Street 2 between Pyrmont Street and Murray Street
  • Edward Lane 2 between Pyrmont Street and Harwood Lane

2 Managed local access via Murray Street. Approach via Darling Drive and left into Murray Street. Exit  via Murray Street southbound and left onto Pyrmont Street. Note: a height restriction of 3.8m of the Western Distributor on-ramp at Murray Street and Pyrmont Street


From 4:00am to 11:30am

Ultimo

properties.otherAdvice:
Brad Paisley concert at Qudos Bank Arena. Doors open from 6pm, main act starts from 9pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Sydney Kings v Brisbane Bullets at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off from 7:30pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v SE Melbourne Phoenix. Tip-off from 7:30pm, finish around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the venue may be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Newcastle Jets. Game start 5pm. Finish at approx 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as soccer fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed from 2:30pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St and will reopen after the game is over.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Monster Jam at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park. Show starts at 6pm and finishes around 8pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the precinct as thousands of fans travel to the event.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Silver Eagle Race Day - The Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 12:35pm, last race at 6:05pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Melbourne Victory at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off from 7:45pm and full-time around 9:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park via Moore Park Rd and the EP3 Southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.otherAdvice:
The 50th NSW Aboriginal Rugby League Knockout carnival will be held from Friday 30 September to Monday 3 October from 7am to 7pm.

Large crowds are expected and traffic delays may be experienced.

No parking is available at the playing fields. Free shuttle bus services will be running from signed locations around Nowra.
properties.displayName: 50th NSW Aboriginal Rugby League Knockout Carnival

properties.diversions: Detour via John Street, Maitland Street and King Street for the duration of the closure. This detour is suitable for all vehicles, including B-doubles. OSOM vehicles will not be permitted on the detour and will be held until the road is re-opened.

properties.publicTransport:
Gerringong Station is the closest station and is approx. a 15 minute walk to the estate.

Visit transportnsw.info for more details and to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
'Unwind in the Vines' will be held at Crooked River Wines, Gerringong on Saturday and Sunday of the October Long Weekend.


On-site parking is extremely limited and all guests parking on-site will require a parking permit to enter the estate. It is strongly recommended using public transport or taxi service to get to and from the event.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT - Unwind in the Vines

properties.otherAdvice:
The Borderline Music and Arts Festival is an open-air music festival held along the banks of the iconic Murray River in Wodonga’s Gateway Lakes, Victoria.

Patrons are encouraged to take advantage of bus/coach services and public transport to get to and from the event as there is limited parking on site.

A 40 km/h speed reduction will be installed on Wodonga Place on the bridge approach to Lincoln Causeway from 11am.

Additional traffic management including speed reductions and traffic controllers will be in place on Lincoln Causeway, adjacent to the event site.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT - Borderline Music and Arts Festival

properties.otherAdvice: The Goulburn Lilac City Festival is Australia's longest continuously-run community festival. It was established in 1951 and has occurred annually, every October long weekend ever since. Sunday has the Service of Blessing at Belmore Park, Markets & Food Stalls all day, Street Parade along Auburn Street, Puppet Shows at the CWA Rooms, Quilt Show at the Soldiers Club and Bell Ringing at St Saviours' Cathedral.
properties.diversions:
Westbound detour via Goldsmith St, Sloan St and Clinton St.

Eastbound detour via Clinton St, Sloan St and Bradley St.

properties.otherAdvice:
The 101st annual Morongla Show will be taking place at Morongla Showground, 15kms south of Cowra on Monday 3rd October 2022.


A 40 km/h speed reduction will be in place in both directions on the Lachlan Valley Way between the hours of 7:00am and 6:00pm.


The Lachlan Valley Way is the major route between Central West NSW and the ACT and higher volumes of traffic than normal are expected on this date due to the October Long Weekend.


Motorists are advised to exercise caution and drive to the conditions.
